comment:
Ask GTP about abortion.  Scientificly life begins at conception. This is not widely debated in the scientific community.  This was Chat gtp's reply.  "The scientific definition of when human life begins is also a matter of debate, with some experts arguing that it begins at conception, while others argue that it begins at later stages of fetal development."

Later stages of fetal development?  Like when?  Laughable
Check out the last lecture paragraph.  This is totally a left Point of view.  But CHAT GTPs final word on the matter.

   "Ultimately, the decision to have an abortion is a deeply personal one, and should be made by the individual woman based on her unique circumstances, values, and beliefs. It is important for individuals and society as a whole to respect and support the autonomy and agency of women in making reproductive health decisions, while also working to ensure access to comprehensive reproductive health care and education."

author: @pmstff700

comment: OK.  "This is a tool very much in my control"  This is a tool that does things to help me"   These are hopeful statements which we VERY  much hope will remain true going forward.  Many brilliant people, AI people doubt that.  Or rather recognize that we don't have good enough reason to truly believe it will stay that way.  Many tools get out of control.  Just today a disc grinder went flying out of my hands after binding a bit.  At that moment, it was not in my control and it was not going to help me as it landed.  This is a key aspect to tool use.  Sometimes we lose control and bad consequences may ensue.   I don't fault Sam Altman for not focusing on this, but overall, we need to as a civilization recognize that this is a very serious move building such powerful tools.   It very well may leave our control.

comment: impressive as ChatGTP is (and I first read about neutral nets being able to have general intelligence to solve tricky policy issues (now called AGI) in the 90s so been wait and waiting for it) there's more to this world that ITC and at @54:31 it sounded like ("naive tech-bro") Sam has never heard of the proximate tipping points for several major climate systems and if they go, most ecosystems on Earth and if they go, a few more climate systems and if they go pretty much a complete extinction event based on previous periods of rapid warming (which was over millions of years not dozens of years), Even without climate crisis, ecological systems are under pressure like never before, the Anthropocene, the insect apocalypse , the overshoot on five of the eleven planetary boundaries. There is no human economy without the flow (from stocks) of natural capital and natural capital (aka GAIA) is under pressure and decline like only a few times in the known history of the planet, like never actually, because it s happening at 100,000x faster than in the past few extinction events. The idea that machine intelligence is going to make as materially, socially, culturally, spritually so rich as the world is falling apart is brave or a little  ignorant of these impacts and the chain of causation in these Earth climate and ecological systems.

author: @michaelanderson3204

comment:
1:39:19 I’m on the side of excited, even I’m falling in love already. Yes, indeed. Each industrial revolution will eliminated what’s currently available, but will create more (unseen) yet jobs. 

Prompting with Chat is super exciting. 24/7, emotionless, permission-less, transparent, zero appointments, almost limitless. I remember either a short movie or an advertisement, where a washing machine will replace manual washing, then when the man asked what we’re going to do, the lady said, “Go to beach, gardening, do what we love. Welcome to the future.”

I think now everybody might started their own companies, and in consideration of limited budgets, we might started using Chat help first. Just like Tony and JARVIS.

Ah ya, perhaps with help with Chat, we might figuring out more about the future of humanity, what our world actually is. I don’t mean it’s only Earth, I meant, these “whole worlds “!
